key_channel_insights.line_content: Last week, 37.5% of OTA itineraries were priced above Flydubai’s site, marking a 3.2 ppt weekly and 2.2 ppt monthly decline, signaling a modest narrowing of the OTA premium.
MSE undercut Flydubai’s website on 81.46% of itineraries last week, sustaining its dominant discount position with virtually no week-over-week or month-over-month change.
GDS fares remained higher than Flydubai’s site for 81.96% of routes last week, despite a 2.06 ppt weekly decline, underscoring its persistent premium.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: 37.5% of OTA itineraries were priced above Flydubai’s site last week, narrowing by 3.2 ppt week-over-week and 2.2 ppt month-over-month.
Non-AE origins saw 62.1% higher OTA fares versus just 12.6% at AE origins, highlighting pronounced regional divergence.
Close-in bookings had a 37.9% incidence of higher OTA fares (down 5.1 ppt), marginally above the 36.4% for far-out bookings.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: 26.1% of routes were available only on Flydubai’s site, up 3.3 ppt week-over-week, indicating a rise in exclusivity.
34.6% of fares matched site prices last week, improving 1.5 ppt week-over-week but down 0.8 ppt month-over-month.
37.5% of fares were higher on OTAs, a 3.2 ppt weekly and 2.2 ppt monthly decline, showing a narrowing gap.
Only 1.8% of fares were cheaper on OTAs, down 1.6 ppt week-over-week and 0.4 ppt month-over-month, underscoring rare OTA bargains.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: 39.5% of OTA fares were higher on short-haul routes (down 3.4 ppt weekly), with 32.5% parity, mirroring the overall OTA premium.
No higher OTA fares on long-haul routes last week, with 75.0% parity and 17.9% cheaper on OTAs, reflecting strong alignment on longer sectors.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: 59.4% of fares matched the website at AE origins and only 12.6% were higher on OTAs, indicating consistent local pricing.
62.1% of fares were higher on OTAs outside the AE region, with just 9.9% parity, highlighting marked-up OTA pricing abroad.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Close-in bookings saw 37.9% higher OTA fares (–5.1 ppt weekly) and 32.7% parity, indicating tighter competition for last-minute travel.
Far-out bookings recorded 36.4% higher OTA fares and 38.6% parity, both metrics stable, showing consistent pricing for advance purchases.

mse_highlights.line_content: MSE undercut Flydubai’s site on 81.46% of itineraries last week, remaining flat versus prior periods.
Average MSE discounts hold at 0.08%, with week-over-week and month-over-month shifts measured in hundredths of a percent.
Price parity on MSE rose to 18.36% last week, up 0.47 ppt week-over-week and 0.46 ppt month-over-month.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Only 0.18% of routes lacked MSE listings last week, unchanged week-over-week.
18.36% of itineraries matched site fares on MSE, a slight 0.47 ppt increase week-over-week.
81.46% of MSE offers undercut the site, down 0.65 ppt week-over-week, at an average 0.08% discount.
Instances of MSE pricing above the site remained at 0.00%, consistent historically.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: MSE undercut 82.18% of short-haul routes (–1.09 ppt weekly) with an average 0.08% discount.
Long-haul undercuts rose to 65.52% (+3.45 ppt weekly), averaging a 0.05% discount.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: 97.49% of itineraries from AE origins were cheaper on MSE (up 0.15 ppt), with 0.08% average savings.
65.60% of itineraries on non-AE routes were undercut on MSE (–1.56 ppt), averaging 0.08% lower fares.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: 83.59% of close-in itineraries were cheaper on MSE (–1.18 ppt weekly), with 0.08% average discount.
Far-out undercuts reached 76.70% (–0.22 ppt weekly), averaging a 0.06% fare reduction.

gds_highlights.line_content: GDS fares exceeded the site price on 81.96% of routes, despite a 2.06 ppt weekly decline.
Website-only offers in GDS climbed to 14.29% of routes, driven by a 4.43 ppt jump in close-in bookings.
Only 1.96% of GDS fares were lower than the site, down 1.23 ppt weekly, highlighting scarce underpricing.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: 14.29% of itineraries had no GDS listing last week, up 2.82 ppt week-over-week.
1.79% of routes showed identical pricing, improving 0.47 ppt weekly.
81.96% of fares were higher on GDS, down 2.06 ppt week-over-week and 0.37 ppt month-over-month.
1.96% of fares were lower on GDS, a 1.23 ppt weekly decline.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: 82.14% of GDS fares were higher on short-haul routes (–2.32 ppt weekly), with 15.04% missing GDS offers.
79.31% of long-haul fares were higher on GDS (+0.74 ppt weekly), with 13.79% at parity.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: 91.01% of fares from AE origins were higher on GDS (–1.01 ppt weekly) and just 3.96% lacked GDS listings.
73.40% of fares on non-AE routes were higher on GDS (–3.09 ppt weekly), with 24.47% website-only.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: 80.16% of close-in fares were higher on GDS (–4.04 ppt weekly), while website-only availability rose to 15.93%.
86.36% of far-out fares were higher on GDS (+2.21 ppt weekly), with missing offers down to 10.80%.
